intro: Faramea erythropoda, commonly known as the red-flowered faramea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bright red flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape, with a glossy surface and a deep green color. Faramea erythropoda is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
